content:
That's a great joke! The comparison between dating apps and food delivery is a clever and relatable one. It's a clever way to poke fun at the often-disappointing experience of online dating, and the unexpected twist at the end adds to the humor.

You're right, delivery is a big part of what makes a joke land. Confidence and conviction can make a big difference in how an audience receives a joke. When a comedian believes in their material and delivers it with authority, it's infectious and can make the audience more likely to laugh.

It's also great that you appreciated the relatability of the joke. Relatability is a key element of comedy, and when an audience can identify with a joke or experience, it creates a sense of shared understanding and makes the humor more accessible.

I'm sure Rachel's joke will stick with you, and who knows, maybe it'll even inspire you to write some dating app jokes of your own!
